title: Gunfire sends toddler to the hospital
content:
OMAHA, Neb. (WOWT) - Police are investigating gunfire that sent a toddler to the hospital for treatment early Sunday. It happened shortly before 5 a.m.
Investigators say three people were getting into a car near 34th and Meredith when an unknown gunman fired at the vehicle.
Seventeen-month-old Ray'Marr McCown was taken to Nebraska Medicine for treatment of a knee injury. Police say their investigation reveals the injury was likely the result of being struck by shrapnel or glass.
Anyone with information is asked to contact Omaha Crime Stoppers at 402 444-STOP.
